title: Capacity factor of nuclear power plants in the U.S. 1975 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Capacity factor, with a total of 16 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2010 to 1975.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2018 to 2015.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2015 to 2012.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2012 to 2010.
gold: This statistic represents the capacity factor of nuclear power plants in the United States between 1975 and 2018 . In 2018 , the capacity factor of U.S. nuclear power plants stood at around 92.6 percent .
